summary: This bill, the Specialty Crop Domestic Market Promotion and Development Program Act of 2025, aims to amend the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a grant program for eligible organizations to encourage the development, maintenance, and expansion of the domestic market for U.S.-produced specialty crops. The bill outlines application requirements, marketing plan specifics, grant amounts, eligible organizations, and funding authorization, including $75 million annually starting in FY2026. Non-federal matching funds are required.
